poem:
### In the Theatre of Dusk

Lines drawn in ashes, skies scorched with sighs,  
A curtain lifted on missiles, not stars.  
In shadowed rooms, secrets murmur,  
Diplomats weave truths between breaths—  
Success, an echo that silences dreams.  
Yet beneath whispered ozone,  
Futures flicker and flinch,  
As daybreak paints its fragile pastels anew.
